name: mine construction, open cast, hard coal | mine infrastructure, open cast, hard coal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/161/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of an opencast mine for hard coal mining. Life time is assumed to be the same as for opencast mines for mining lignite. Thus, an average life time of 30 years is considered for machinery. ;;Data represent first approximations due to the insufficient availability of data. The estimates are based on data about four opencast mines: Oberdorf (Austria), Kans-Achinsk/Ekibastuz (Russia), Rheinbraun AG (Germany) and Rietspruit (South Africa). Hence, only figures per tone hard coal were given in literature and no information about average annual production of hard coal was available. Due to these facts a total production of 100 million tons has been assumed to represent a worldwide average (excluding small mines in China). This estimation includes both opencast and underground mines; therefore the total production shall be seen more as a normalization factor than an actual average value for the production of open pit mines.;; Due to the fact that hard coal has to be treated, higher figures for infrastructure are considered. It has to be considered that this dataset is based on few data about opencast mines thus it may not reflect specific mines. Even with a broader database it would not have been possible to calculate assured mean values. This is due to the fact that there are big differences between mines and complete data of several hundred mines would have been required.;;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From unspecified land forseen for an opencast mine for hard coal mining.

This activity ends with an opencast mine unit for hard coal mining. This dataset includes machinery and equipment with a life time of 30 years because this information is not seperated in the literature given. It also includes requirements for prospecting. Land use is included as well. In this dataset explosives are considered via blasting.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Resource Extraction; Fuels

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
Estimation. After operation it is assumed that all materials except from wood on the surface are left in situ.

flow.name: mine infrastructure, open cast, hard coal
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. In this dataset specific plywood consumption of 0.003 kg/t pit coal is used. Elevators, cooling systems, processing installations, loading facilities, administration buildings and sanitary installations have to be taken into account. It is not clearly possible to differentiate between data belonging to infrastructure and operation of the mine. Due to this, requirements for wood are included in the infrastructure dataset; the rest of material consumption is considered in the operation dataset.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. In this dataset specific steel consumption of 0.07 kg/t pit coal is used. Elevators, cooling systems, processing installations, loading facilities, administration buildings and sanitary installations have to be taken into account. It is not clearly possible to differentiate between data belonging to infrastructure and operation of the mine. Due to this, requirements for steel are included in the infrastructure dataset; the rest of material consumption is considered in the operation dataset.


Further references:

Pers. Mitteilung von N. Schlösser, Rheinbraun AG, Köln.

Estimation. Due to the fact that hard coal is embedded in hard rocks blasting is assumed. Therefore, high amounts of explosives are required. The amount of explosives required is considered in this module.

It is not clearly possible to differentiate between data belonging to infrastructure and operation of the mine. Due to this, requirements for concrete are included in the infrastructure dataset; the rest of material consumption is considered in the operation dataset.
